FacilityName: DFA Dairy Brands Fluid, LLC dba Purity Dairy
OperatorName: DFA Dairy Brands Fluid, LLC dba Pur

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

Purity Dairy operates a production facility where fluid milk, and juice products are processed, packaged, and distributed. We receive, store, and distribute milk. 



Ammonia is used at our facility as the cooling medium in our refrigeration system. The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system; it is designed to remain inside the piping and vessels in our facility.  We believe that ammonia provides the safest and most efficient cooling choice for our operation. 



A. Describe the Accident Release Prevention and Emergency Policies 

We take many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia from the refrigeration system.  These precautions include safety controls (alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions like pressure increases that could cause a system failure.  We also have a preventive maintenance program designed to maintain the on-going integrity of the systems, a training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified personnel and emergency response procedures that enable trained personnel to respond quickly to system upsets. 



B. Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled 

Ammonia is the only substance covered by the Accidental Release Prevention Regulations handled at this facility. 



C. Description of the Accidental Release Prevention Program 

The facility has an accident release prevention program that complies with Occupational Safety and Health Act's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Program Rule. The prevention program consists of the following elements: 

?    Employee Participation Program

?    Process Safety Information

?    Process Hazard Analysis

?    Operating Procedures

?    Training Program

?    Contractor Safety Program

?    Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures

?    Mechanical Integrity Program

?    Hot Work Permit Procedures

?    Management of Change Procedures

?    Incident Investigation P

rocedures

?    Compliance Audit Procedures 



D. Five-Year Accident History 

No ammonia-related accidents have occurred at the facility over the past five years that resulted in significant onsite or offsite consequences.

 

 

E. Description of the Emergency Response Program 

Purity Dairy is using Nashville Fire Department as the Hazmat first responder to an incident in the event of an uncontrolled release. Purity Dairy has an Emergency Action plan in place, which describes how the facility will respond to an ammonia release and other emergencies. The plan includes First Aid procedures, Emergency Medical Treatment procedures, Evacuation plans, Notification / Communication and Re-entry procedures, and Training and Drill programs



F. Planned Changes to Improve Safety 

Future changes to improve release prevention include addition of new technology as it becomes available, and continued training of plant personnel.
